links.title: Australian teen stole 90 gigabytes of private data from Apple servers
links.description: A Melbourne, Australia teenager is facing criminal charges after accessing Apple's backend network multiple times over a year, according to Australian newspaper The Age . He apparently did this out of love, his lawyer says, because he admired the company and "dreamed of" working there.

links.title: Cramer: Forget FANG, the market loves WANG
links.description: It might be time to rethink FANG, according to CNBC's Jim Cramer. FANG, which stands for Facebook, Amazon, Netflix and Google, was coined by the " Mad Money" host himself to refer to the group of high-performing tech stocks. But given Thursday's market moves, Cramer thinks WANG - Walmart, Apple, Netflix and Google - might be the new group to watch.
